item.title: React Advent Calendar – keto vegan, gluten free and no parabens or plastic wrapping
item.description: TL;DR: I made an advent calendar in React, my wife loved it I grew up with a lot of creative advent calendars. The one type I didn’t get was the standard chocolate one that’s most common these days. While I’ve not consistently been very good at paying this forward, I do make an effort some years to do something a bit different for my wife. Yes, my wife; the kids get standard ones :P This year’s plan was simple: create an online calendar with cozy favors, encouragements and the like each day until Christmas.

item.title: create-elm-live-app – the smallest npm package ever?
item.description: The problem I’ve been tinkering a bit with Elm lately. The super-enforced functional and minimal paradigm is very refreshing, and serves as a sort of detox after spending one too many hour stuck in Android’s not-so-lovely XML + mutating class world. Setting up a new bare minimum Elm app should be quite simple, but it turns out that there are a few more steps required than one would expect.

item.title: About
item.description: What floats my boat Following Jesus Best. Wife. Ever. Raising three incredible giant killers I also like Telling stories in a creative way (AKA working in tech) Music! Particularly playing drums or the guitar <3 Super Smash Bros Top three values as a software engineer Integrity Creativity Excellence

item.title: Development plan 2021-2023
item.description: What follows is my own personal development plan as a software engineer at Vipps. Some terms and expressions are a bit internal, as they will no doubt be for you as well on your own plan (should you find yourself inspired to write one), but I’ll leave it as is. Enjoy! Context I’ve been at Vipps since 2018, mostly doing work that now belongs in the “Merchant Core” team.

item.title: pretty-git-report – a CLI to give you daily commit metrics
item.description: Have you ever… Wanted to track your daily additions and deletions without leaving your beloved terminal? Busted your back piping git log {insert-hundred-flags} through endless hoops trying to create a somewhat human readable and useful output? Wanted to use a functional node.js cli with an immoral amount of Rambda usage? (Sorry about that, btw, I just wanted to see how far I could go. Quite far, it turns out!
